bugzillamozillaorg_serge_20140323@gautherie.fr
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> Strange as this behavior is, does it create a problem?

No problem with current test code, that's why I call it a nit. (See bug 615546.)
comments.author: bugzillamozillaorg_serge_20140323@gautherie.fr
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> Strange as this behavior is, does it create a problem?

No problem with current test code, that's why I call it a nit. (See bug 615546.)

(In reply to comment #3)
> *SM22: locationbar can actually be hidden, hence the reported failure.
>  Neil, do we want to change SeaMonkey behavior, or just to update this test?
>  (I would guess the former might be wanted for security reason!?)

Neil, ping.

Ftr, as you hinted at in bug 642338 comment 35:
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/app/profile/firefox.js
{
417 // This is the pref to control the location bar, change this to true to 
418 // force this - this makes the origin of popup windows more obvious to avoid
419 // spoofing. We would rather not do it by default because it affects UE for web
420 // applications, but without it there isn't a really good way to prevent chrome
421 // spoofing, see bug 337344
422 pref("dom.disable_window_open_feature.location",  true);
}
NB: I have not tested this but I assume this is the preference.
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> *SM22: locationbar can actually be hidden, hence the reported failure.
>  Neil, do we want to change SeaMonkey behavior, or just to update this test?
>  (I would guess the former might be wanted for security reason!?)

Neil, ping.

Ftr, as you hinted at in bug 642338 comment 35:
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/app/profile/firefox.js
{
417 // This is the pref to control the location bar, change this to true to 
418 // force this - this makes the origin of popup windows more obvious to avoid
419 // spoofing. We would rather not do it by default because it affects UE for web
420 // applications, but without it there isn't a really good way to prevent chrome
421 // spoofing, see bug 337344
422 pref("dom.disable_window_open_feature.location",  true);
}
NB: I have not tested this but I assume this is the preference.
